storyInfo: Viviana takes a great risk to visit Arturia and learns that the Güldenesgesatz remains the key to the plot. With Das Kaiserinnensfest about to begin, Viviana and Federico unsuccessfully attempt to stop the performance of the Güldenesgesatz.

attributes.content: Stop knocking on the window sill. Are you trying to send a secret message?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: As you can see, I am unable to play my cello because it's been Arts-locked. It is... uncomfortable.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Unless you would care to join me for a chat.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Absolutely not.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Very well then. I suppose I'll have to wait for another guest.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Try anything funny, and we'll bind your arms and legs with Arts.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: My apologies, but Grimmacht has forbidden anyone from meeting with Arturia.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Not even an Empresses' Voice?
No exceptions.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Then what about... Ewigegnade's envoy?
...Ewigegnade sent you?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Was that not clear enough?
Now this is a surprise.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: To think you'd be the first to come and see me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This is the second time we've met, Arturia.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Oh, more than that, I would think.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How many times have we met, in the sound of music?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I see your words are as mysterious as your music. And yourself.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Me? Mysterious?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: On the contrary, I'm far more open and frank than most.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So an Empresses' Voice, a paragon of law and order, has come to meet with a dangerous felon alone. Even going as far as to fake an empress's orders to do so... That must have taken quite a bit of determination.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You knew I wasn't sent by Ewigegnade?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: There's nothing she could possibly want to ask me. But you, Viviana, your face is full of question marks. So what would you like to know, from your former enemy?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Allow me to guess... you want to know the truth behind your father's death.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: That said, I'm not used to answering questions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Do I need to offer you something in exchange?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: A trade, hm... How about you simply open yourself up to me, and allow me to search your heart?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Oh, pardon my impertinence.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Then let's tell a story together, as usual.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Once upon a time, there was a child who lived on top of a tower in the middle of a storm.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Until the age of nine, she never left her little room in the tower.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You know my—
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Oh, don't give me that look. Like I said, this is simply a story we're telling together.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Imagine that you're a part of it, and... reach out to yourself.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Very well.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Tell me, what is it about the tower that left the deepest impression on the child?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The window.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It was a small room. The window was small, too. You could reach out and touch the cold, wet clouds.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The storms rarely abate in Sturmland, do they?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ja. Dark lightning often knocked at the window. My mother would hold me, telling stories and reading me poems in a soft, gentle voice.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: What about your father?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: He... One night a week, he would come to the spire where I lived, bringing me books and teaching me to play instruments.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You looked forward to these meetings. Did you leave your room and wait for him at the top of the staircase, when it was almost time?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When I was little. But I stopped.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The skies were very dark that day. It had been a long time my father's last visit. I was out of candles, and I wanted to find some, so I went further than I usually did.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I saw so many children and adults. The music combined with their laughter was louder than the thunder.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: That's when you realized that not every child had to stay in their room like you did. That they could hold their parents' hands, and dance and sing to their hearts' delight.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Did you see your father there? Did you look for him?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I wanted to, but my mother pulled me back. She covered my ears, and tried to cover my eyes too... It hurt a bit, but I didn't dare say anything.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: She brought you back to your little room. Did you look up?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Nein. I... I kept my eyes closed. I heard my mother crying, but I didn't dare look at her.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Didn't dare?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Ja. I didn't dare go down the stairs. I didn't dare look for my father anymore.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I never looked up again, even after my mother passed away, when my father sent me away from the spire.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: My father was a Kurfürst. He and my mother weren't married. My existence was a secret that would hurt my mother and make things difficult for my father if anyone found out.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No, that's not what I'm asking. How did you feel?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You were the one trapped in the spire. You were the one forbidden to recognize your father. You were the one who watched your mother waste away. You were the one sent away from home.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When you went to Kazimierz and decided to become a knight, you held a sliver of expectation.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: After all, the stories of your childhood, the stories about knights, had long been your source of comfort.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But you soon realized you were no more than a puppet of the General Chamber of Commerce.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Even your childhood in the spire was boiled down to an exotic label. 'The Leithanian.' An advertisement destined to sell in the markets of both countries.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You left the arena after getting on the wrong side of the KGCC. You thought you would finally have some peace and quiet, only to be summoned back to Leithanien by a letter from your father.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Once again, you find your fate written by another. Illegitimate child, competition knight, Empresses' Voice. You never chose any of these identities.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And it all started on that spire, at the top of those stairs.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...You're right.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's been so many years, but sometimes I feel like I'm still there.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Like I never left it.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Once again, think back to the memory that left the deepest impression.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That day, when your father took your hand and descended the seemingly endless stairs... You didn't look up.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I couldn't.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: If I did, he would see the tear stains on my face, and the tears in my eyes...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Anger.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: 'I already lost my mother. Why are you pushing me away like this?'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ja. I had... nothing.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why abandon me?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I already lost my mother. Why did I have to lose my father too?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why couldn't you have waited in Marigold Alley just a little longer?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why did you write for me to come back, only to leave me again once I'd returned with hope in my heart?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Arturia does not answer.
She simply gazes at Viviana, at the ripples in the lake of her eyes.
If silence can be considered an expression of sound, then their emotions could resonate even without a melody.
Anger, frustration, pain. The same emotions reflected in Arturia's eyes.
She sighs, and awakens the dreamer from her memory with gentle words.
That's enough storytime.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Kurfürst Werner was my friend, Viviana.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Our meeting was so ordinary that it's hardly worth mentioning. He was a high noble, but also a sensitive and romantic artist. We often spoke about music.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A few months ago, his envoy found me while I was traveling.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: He knew his days were numbered. All he wanted was to see his beloved again, through my music.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: He wanted to see Mother?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Not just Lucinda, but you as well.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Werner did reminisce about his romance with Lucinda, but he spent even more time in that little room on the spire.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Those nights with you and your mother were his only comfort in those painful early days as Kurfürst.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That's how I knew your story.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So it wasn't...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No, I did not use Arts on you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I'd already met you countless times, through Werner's mind's eye.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You must hear this often, but you really are so much like your father.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But it was only when I saw you in person that I realized...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You're more than just that flickering candle.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: More than... what?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're so much stronger, so much tougher than a candleflame.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Now, I've told you everything I could.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Kurfürst Werner died over the copy of the Güldenesgesatz. On that matter, you know as much as I do.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...You told me he knew his end was coming. Which means he knew how he would die.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Protecting the Güldenesgesatz was his vow to the Twins, and his duty as Kurfürst of Sturmland.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Whether it was the Movement or its loss, the responsibility and blame lie solely on Sturmland.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Only by giving his life for it could he protect his loved ones and House Hochberg, all while ridding himself of a ticking time bomb.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It was all for the Güldenesgesatz?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I think... I understand.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: One last bit of advice, to thank you for your trust and sincerity.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When I first saw you, I also saw the shadow behind you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But now, it's growing, filling the entire staircase outside.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Danke, Arturia... for the answers.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: My dear Viviana... How pitiable, how noble...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Will you be swallowed by the shadow?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Whew, made it.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: You move so quickly, Herr Erich, I could hardly keep up.
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: Pardon my excitement. I thought I wouldn't be able to leave Sturmland, but the Empresses' Voice delayed the visit.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Kurfürsten succession ceremonies rarely take this long, not since the reign of the Witch King...
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: Stop worrying. While in Zwillingstürme, what could be more important than seeing Their Majesties?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Hurry, and we may even secure a seat closer to the Twin Spires before anyone else arrives... Hey, why is that man not moving?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Guten Tag!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Are you here for Das Kaiserinnensfest too?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: I suppose so.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Where is your instrument, then? What are you going to do for the ensemble?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: The ensemble?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The ensemble of the Güldenesgesatz! The most important part of the ceremony, bathing in the glory of both the Golden Melody and Leithanien!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: This is my master's first time attending. I have his flute with me.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Ah, of course. Do forgive my nosiness. Which Kreis do you hail from?
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: Does it matter?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Oh, no, I don't mean to pry, only that it's customary for those from the same Kreis to stand together.
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: I see. Please, go ahead. We will follow.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Oh, very good then! I mean, danke, meine Herr. May Grimmacht's glory and Ewigegnade's blessings orbit you like the sun.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Seeing the Twin Empresses' spires for the first time?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The white dress of Ewigegnade, the Eternal Grace.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The black blade of Grimmacht, the Austere Authority.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Their two spires resemble them so very much.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Twin Spires are Zwillingstürme's namesake. They're the pride of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: No matter how beautiful, they're no more than two elaborate cages.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: An apt metaphor.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Das Kaiserinnensfest... They say it's for all Leithanians, but only nobles are allowed to join in the ensemble at the amphitheater.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It is, in effect, a performance of an Arts ritual.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: A ritual?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Did you see the bridge connecting the spires?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: That's where the Twin Empresses play every year. The sound of the pipe organ and violin are amplified by the resonance between the buildings, spreading to every corner of Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: So it's some kind of... Arts.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The old man told me that it's the work of Herkunftshorn. He turned Vedunien into a massive Arts device, with the bell tower of Weinshof at the center.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: And the Twin Empresses have built upon the Witch King's Arts.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: To avoid making the same mistake as him, they set the Twin Spires as the center of the resonance, effectively tuning the entire city and making it virtually impossible to assail the Spires from the outside.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Anyone wanting to attack the Kaiserinnen will either need to destroy the entire palace area where the Spires are located, or work from within.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Spoken like someone who's given some thought to planning such an attack.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Wait, don't tell me you actually—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If we see the Gendarmerie or the Empresses' Voice, remind me to run faster than you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...Quiet.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The celebration is about to begin. People are coming, try to blend into the crowd. Don't just stand there like earlier.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: What about when the ensemble begins? We didn't bring any instruments, unless your sword is a fair bit more versatile than it looks.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If the ensemble begins.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I met that distant relative of yours.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Exactly as you predicted, she offered a generous lead.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Perhaps we really are trapped in some kind of illusion they created.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: What if the Witch King's remnants aren't trying to use the Güldenesgesatz to get to the Witch King's legacy, but to use the Witch King's powers to tamper with it?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: What if their goal has never truly changed?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...What are you still doing here, meine Dame?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: All the Empresses' Voices in Zwillingstürme have been summoned to the amphitheater.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Ah, I was... I'll be on my way.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hm, this cell holds a dangerous felon, and it is quite far from the amphitheater. I'll need to contact Grimmacht's...
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: I would not recommend that.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A Sankta?! What's a Sankta doing here?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster
Imperial Caster
attributes.content: Let's catch him together, meine Dame! He may well be in league with Arturia!

attributes.name: Imperial Caster
attributes.content: Nngh?!
...Sorry.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I was about to ask your opinion on how to handle this.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: So if I weren't here, you would have simply done it yourself?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: My presence here already violates diplomatic protocol. An additional rule being broken is of little consequence, other than in terms of the subsequent clean-up.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You are an Empresses' Voice. Michael has told me of your circumstances.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I appreciate your kind gesture.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It was my own decision to visit Arturia.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I didn't want my father's death to be meaningless.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I didn't want to keep my head down and pretend nothing had happened.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I wanted to fight for something, to finally seize my own fate with my two hands.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...You chose to let Arturia perform your heart's music?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Nein.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The melody was always there, echoing in my heart. I just chose not to listen to it until now.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I believe she's telling the truth that the Güldenesgesatz is at the heart of the problem.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The Imperial casters have recovered the copy of Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: However, I have learned that Arturia has an accomplice with whom she was in close contact. The available evidence indicates that this person may not have been the mastermind behind the Ludwigs-Universität incident.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hm... then we can assume that the Witch King's remnants have already obtained the Arts recorded in the copy.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The Güldenesgesatz will be performed by over ten thousand people at the amphitheater.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: If the Witch King's remnants are in that crowd... the consequences will be unimaginable.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I would like to share our current findings with Michael.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Sure. He might be able to persuade Grimmacht.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But that's not enough. We must take action ourselves... even without Their Majesties permission.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The musicians and instruments are in position, Frau Löwenstein.
attributes.name: Imperial Musician

attributes.content: Very well. Give me a moment while I double-check the amplification Arts.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You're back, Amelie? Did you forget something?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: No need to be nervous. This is your first public performance as part of the orchestra. Just hold your instrument steady and focus on the melody. Pay no mind to anyone watching.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Oh... it's you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Adjust the direction of that Arts Unit, will you? Turn it counterclockwise 15... 17 degrees.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Ja, that's how it should sound. But why are you here at this hour? Is Ewigegnade still concerned about the effect on the performance?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Frau Löwenstein... where are the other musicians?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: At the amphitheater.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The performance of the Güldenesgesatz will begin in ten minutes. The Reichsorchester needs a good start under the direction of the Kaiserin.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Only ten minutes?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The Kaiserin's weather casters have forecasted the exact time of today's sunset. As per custom, the performance of the Güldenesgesatz will conclude just as the last ray fades.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The rehearsal schedule has been hard, but we'll be able to rest once we get through this evening.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You too, Viviana. I've been thinking... You'll need to find a long-term residence in Zwillingstürme, if you're to remain by the Kaiserin's side when this all over.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Would you like to stay at my place?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I have a little mansion in Bachshof. I just had the walls repainted.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Brandt planted some vines, which he says goes well with the walls. But to be honest, I'd like a second opinion before I commit.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Frau Löwenstein... Cora.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ja? What is it?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: How might one stop the performance of the Güldenesgesatz?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why do you ask? This performance has been the most important part of Das Kaiserinnensfest for the last twenty-three years. So many people are waiting in the amphitheater in front of the Spires.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I've almost gotten to the bottom of these tragedies.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm sure the enemy's plan has something to do with the Güldenesgesatz. They cannot be allowed to succeed.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And how did you learn this? Have you told Ewigegnade?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I don't know who to trust... I can't stop thinking about who killed my father.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You suspect Their Majesties? You're an Empresses' Voice, Viviana!
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Who's there?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: A friend. He's keeping watch.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The empresses' casters are coming.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: So soon?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It will take more than ten minutes to neutralize them.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The performance of the Güldenesgesatz is about to begin.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Don't fight them.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I'll be with you, Viviana, no matter what you do.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You believe me?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Do you even need to ask? Besides, I can't let you put yourself in danger.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You want to stop the Reichsorchester from playing the Güldenesgesatz, right? I'll take you there.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...They've gone out.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: The candles on the stairs. The room is so much darker now, don't you think?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What are you doing? Stay away from the door.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: There are less people out there now.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Have they... gone after that lovely Empresses' Voice?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Frau Hochberg is suspected to have fallen under your influence. She will be taken into custody until the conclusion of the celebration.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: It was a mistake to allow her to meet with you.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: A mistake, you say?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You knew the new Empresses' Voice was the daughter of a Kurfürst, and had the favor of Ewigegnade.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Compared to working in Grimmacht's dark Spire, you clearly show more interest in its twin, the white Spire.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So you let the empress's new favorite come in without the proper checks, just to curry favor with her.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Wh-What are you babbling about?!
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: But you soon realized the danger. Let me guess: Viviana did something unbefitting of her status after she left, didn't she?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Now you're afraid. Grimmacht and her executors will not tolerate such a gross error. You would lose any chance of promotion, perhaps even your freedom.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So why did you make a second mistake, then?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Wha... music! How can this be?!
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Grimmacht, please... Nein, spare me! I-I can't listen...
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Too late. There are just too many instruments in Leithanien. Your Arts Units, like your souls, are laid bare before me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Your kn-knocking...
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: You dared not carry your instruments with you in my presence, so you left them outside the door. But in your haste, you forgot the protective Arts.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You forgot that vibrations can be transmitted.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The tiniest tremor of a string, and you're hearing my music.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Check my crown, would you?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Your fingers are cold.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Sorry. How about this? That better?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: You've been clutching your sword all day. Its chill has rubbed off on you.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...It's time. We should head to the bridge.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Hildegard...
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Ja? What is it?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Am I pretty today?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: As always.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Grimmacht!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: ...Ewigegnade.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Your wolf cub is here.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Go first, Lieselotte. The people are waiting.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We've always walked out onto the bridge together.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Nothing is obliged to stay the same forever.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: I'll find you before the performance begins.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: So why are you here? I thought you preferred it down below.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: I have an urgent matter to report.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Bring my violin. We'll talk on the way.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Nein!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Please, you must order the celebration to be halted. The Witch King's remnants are in the crowd, planning a massive attack!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Proof?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: ...Please, just give me a little time. I'll find the proof.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You didn't use to be so brash, Michael. That reckless Sankta has changed you.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Federico... the Lateran executor believes that a larger incident is in the works, and it has something to do with Arturia. We should interrogate her!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: What does she know about the Güldenesgesatz, who are her supporters, what are she and her accomplices planning... As long as the performance of the Güldenesgesatz can be delayed, I can—
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I see you believe the Celebration to be a mere festivity.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Er...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The 'Kaiserinnensfest' first took place twenty-three years ago, on the day we killed the Witch King.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: But there were no empresses, and no celebration, only soldiers fallen in battle, and a tired and frightened people.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We defeated the Witch King in the early dawn, and spent the next few hours cleaning up his followers. At dusk, Lieselotte and I descended the Spire, walked down its bloody steps, and—
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Announced our victory with a duet.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Today, the ten thousand people of the ensemble come from every Kreis, from all four corners of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Every Leithanian, every friend of Leithanien, and every enemy of Leithanien has their eyes on the Twin Spires. On Grimmacht and Ewigegnade.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: And you want me to suspend, even cancel, the ensemble based on the hypothesis of a Lateran executor who has already caused his fair share of trouble in our country.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Perhaps I expected too much of you.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: You should have known I would respond like this before you even spoke. And if you truly believed in your judgment, you should have acted on your own.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: On that account, the daughter of Werner von Hochberg is far more resolute than you.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: How long have you been with me, Michael?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Seven years.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: It's time to let you go.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: What? Why would you say that?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: There comes a day when one must shoulder more responsibility, for the sake of Leithanien's future.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Bring me my violin. It's time I went to the bridge.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: The orchestra is ten meters below us.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The sun has... painted the clouds red.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Three minutes, fifty seconds until the performance begins.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I will fire a blank. The noise should cause some of the musicians to scatter and interrupt the performance.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The musicians of the Reichsorchester are all Arts masters, each one the equal of an Empresses' Voice. We would be drowned in Arts the moment you showed an intent to attack.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The equivalent of ninety-seven Empresses' Voices, then.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Plus two squads of approaching casters, for a total of one hundred twenty.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I can give you three minutes.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You must secure the remaining twenty-three seconds on your own, Seniora Hochberg.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Three minutes? But if this is the only way...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Delay the casters. Leave the rest to me.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The shadows of the Twin Spires stretch as the sun sinks towards the horizon.
They swallow up the shadows of the musicians, of Cora, of Viviana herself.
She has never felt her power unleashed like this.
She is reminded of that flickering candlelight in the spire.
It was a tiny flame that only illuminated a corner of the bed. Leaving the other corners, the spiral staircase, and the night beyond the spire in total darkness.
There was a time when she couldn't admit that the darkness would linger in her eyes longer than that tiny speck of candlelight.
...Success.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I cut off the connection between some of the musicians and their instruments.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: What's going on? We're being affected by somebody's Arts.
attributes.name: Imperial Musician

attributes.content: You... Frau Löwenstein? Are you being held hostage?
attributes.name: Imperial Musician

attributes.content: You could say that.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Nein.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Amelie.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You're in league with each other?!
attributes.name: Imperial Musician

attributes.content: I made my choice, and I will not hesitate.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Could you please... just put down your instrument for a while?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: There are fluctuations of Arts energy coming from below the Twin Spires... and some commotion from where the orchestra is.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The Witch King's remnants?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Possibly.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Strange. There should be Gesatzswächter in the area, but I don't see any. Why?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Kaiserinnen knew that something terrible would happen here. They're prepared to abandon the Twin Spires if necessary. They'll even abandon all the—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Meine Herr!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: ...You were from Sturmland, ja?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why do you look like someone spooked you? The ensemble is about to begin. Here, I have an extra flute. You can borrow it.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: A flute?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This performance is not to be missed!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Nein, you can't be here.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Go! Leave the amphitheater!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You'd like a better position? I suppose we could squeeze—
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: I'm not—Do not you see these?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: See what?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: The dice I'm holding! My Arts Unit!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What are you doing? You'll give yourself away!
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Does it even matter, at this point?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Look around. There must be ten thousand people here... No, we can't even worry about that now. All we can do is save as many as we can. Even just one more...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's too loud here!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: I can't hear a word you're saying!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Look at me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Look at my Arts. Do they remind you of anything? I am an Urtica. My Arts come from the same lineage as him. You should be afraid! Run!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Amazing! Do you hear that? The Imperial musicians just played the first note!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: The performance of the Güldenesgesatz has begun!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: The black Arts orb rises from his hand and into the air, exploding into a reddish black shadow.
It is quickly buried by even more brilliant rays of Arts.
Rays created by various Originium Arts interweave in the clouds.
Both the melody and the Arts come from the people on the ground, all focused on performing the music belonging to Leithanien alone, using instruments that also serve as Arts Units.
Even the buildings resonate with the Twin Spires, turning the empty space around the Kaiserinnen's towers into a true amphitheater.
The colors penetrating the clouds continue to shift with the splendid melody, as though the crowd is performing the color of the sunset in the sky.
It is a feast of sight and sound, woven together by Arts. The ultimate expression of Leithanien's classical aesthetics and mastery over Arts.
It is a grand spectacle visible from any corner of Zwillingstürme, and beyond.
Tears begin to fill Ebenholz's eyes.
He remembers standing atop the spire of Urtica, gazing down at the plate below.
There were many bell towers in the Grafschaft, which sang every day at dusk.
The people would leave their workshops after a long day of work, and the sound of wheels rolling over metallic roads would echo with the music filling the city.
He could see the green-black wilderness, if he stood on his toes. Einwald was filled with forests, and caravans brought ripe fruit into the city whenever they were in season.
Farmers often amplified their scents with Arts to attract customers. He could always smell the best fruits, even from his high perch.
The maid who sympathized with him would sneak a few back from the market, as long as no other nobles were watching.
The fruits were ripe and fresh, unlike the carefully selected, dried and withered food served on the long, old table.
He could not remember what became of the maid. Did she go join her beloved in the south? Or did she find a new job at the instrument workshop beneath the spire?
And, when he left Urtica... did he ever look back?
Yes, he had once loved this place from the bottom of his heart.
Leithanien, the land of divine music, cradle of the Arts.
The performance has begun.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It sounds so harmonious, even without the strings.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: There's a theory I've heard, though I've never tried to verify it.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The Güldenesgesatz contains the will of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It represents order, harmony, and beauty.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The golden melody is deeply rooted in the soul of every Leithanian, and is not so easily damaged.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: That sounds like a form of Originium Arts. It shares some characteristics with our law, but works on different principles, and on a different target.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: So... the Güldenesgesatz is actually a kind of complex Arts affecting the cognition of every Leithanian who hears it?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Cast by... more than ten thousand people in ensemble.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: So we can't disrupt the performance, but what about the enemy? What's their plan?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The enemy's plan is undoubtedly the opposite.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: They want the music to continue. Therefore, there is only one place they can be hiding.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Wh-What are you doing?
attributes.name: Imperial Musician

attributes.content: I put down my cello as you asked!
attributes.name: Imperial Musician

attributes.content: Frau Hochberg and I have not prevented any musician from leaving.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Your colleagues are either resisting her Arts, or chose to avoid confrontation due to Frau Löwenstein's presence.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You are the only one to have stayed behind.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Very astute, Sankta.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: We have waited far too long to hear the music that truly belongs to Leithanien.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The other Witch King's remnants are amongst the musicians?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Stay away from them, Cora!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Are you... crying?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm listening to the Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The Movement?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's just so beautiful.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It reminded me of how much I used to love Leithanien.
attributes.name: Cora
